content.question: If <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, f of x, d x, equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> and <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, g of x, d x, equals negative 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, 3 times f of x, minus, g of, x, close parenthesis, d x, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
